name: powerful
content:
powerful adjective
(CONTROL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 having a lot of power to control people and events: The president is more powerful than the prime minister. She's the most powerful person in the organization.
More examplesFewer examplesThe president is so powerful that he is able to dictate to the government.He was a powerful force in British politics during the war years.I get the impression that Sheila is the powerful one in that relationship, not her husband!Today's teachers are not the powerful authority figures they once were.Are multinational companies now more powerful than governments?
